column4: Well, you can read and write ext3 from windows if that's any help (and you can read NTFS from linux very well)

trust me you don't want to use wine, there is a linux equivalent for every windows app I know, you just will want your data, everything else is VERY unproductive. (there is a NTFS driver out there that ulitalizes the original windows drivers (and that for works nearly perfectly), but I've forgotten the name)
I'm interested in getting my windows games to work mostly.
Well what abour Cedega? (if you don't want to pay use the CVS version)
